intro: Schizomussaenda henryi, commonly known as Henry's schizomussaenda, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in the spring. Schizomussaenda henryi is notable for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional remedies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
